newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit seen still weak despite Negara rate checks.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit seen still weak despite Negara rate checks.

text.p: The ringgit remains vulnerable to falls against the dollar later on Friday or next week, despite rumours of a rate-check by the Malaysian central bank earlier, dealers said.
Dollar/ringgit could test its immediate resistance at 2.5250 as the market "wants to test Bank Negara", said a dealer at a Malaysian bank.

The central Bank Negara was heard checking rates at around 2.5240 a dollar today, to indicate its displeasure at the weak-trending ringgit, dealers said. "They were checking rates at 40, but didn't come in," said the dealer.
